security: Disclosing that James W. McCord Jr. is being recommended for an honor for his work on audio-countermeasures, combined with the description of his work, would provide insight into a highly sensitive field and is classified.
summary: A memorandum recommending James W. McCord, Jr. and others for an Honor and Merit Award for their work improving the Agency's Audio-countermeasures Program, specifically in the development of a new fluoroscopic scanning technique for detecting clandestine microphones.
summary_one_paragraph: This is a memorandum dated August 4, 1966, from Ellin L. Beatty, Executive Secretary/HMAB, to the Security Advisor, Honor and Merit Awards Board, forwarding a recommendation for an Honor and Merit Award for James W. McCord, Jr. The recommendation highlights McCord's work, along with Alan F. Petit and William M. Marcy, in the Technical Division of the Office of Security, for their development of a unique fluoroscopic scanning technique that significantly improves the Agency's ability to detect hidden technical listening devices; it also mentions their design of a portable package for the equipment.
title: Honor Recommendation for JAMES W. MCCORD, JR.
recipient: Security Advisor, Honor and Merit Awards Board
